{{disambig-two|the Power: Brother '''Joseph Power''' ([[2 February]] [[1925]] - [[19 October]] [[2011]]<ref>[http://obituaries.pressherald.com/obituaries/mainetoday-pressherald/obituary.aspx?page=lifestory&pid=154259317 Obituary: Brother Joseph Power] at [http://www.pressherald.com/ Portland Press Herald/Maine Sunday Telegram] (accessed 30 October 2011)</ref>) was a professor of English Language and Literature at [[wikipedia:Walsh University|Walsh University]]. He received his B.A. from the [[wikipedia:University of London|University of London]]
with the forename Joseph: and later gained an exhibition to St. Catherine's College
who encountered [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in t: Oxford (reading for an Honors Degree in English Language and Literature).<ref>[http://www.doy.org/viewpast.asp?ID=1716 The Roman Catholic Diocese of  Youngstown]
with the forenames Norman Sandiford: announcing the Walsh University holding its 2005 Commencement ceremony (accessed 25 July 2010)</ref>

{{disambig-two|the Power: During this time he visited [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s house for evening instruction in [[Old English]]
with the forename Joseph: but instead joined the Tolkiens in a celebration of the republication of ''[[The Hobbit]]'' (likely the second edition of [[1951]]<ref>According to [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]]. Cf. [http://www.lotrplaza.com/forum/forum_posts.asp?TID=229888 Brother Joseph Power's experiences of Tolkien] at Lotrplaza.com (accessed 31 July 2010)</ref>).<ref>''A Wizard's Apprentice 1/4: Meeting Tolkien and C.S. Lewis''</ref>
